infoSeeds.text: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him on the last day. For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
infoSeeds.infoSupportText: The word for eat is Trogo, meaning to gnaw in Greek.
Jesus did not back down. He persisted!
infoSeeds.text: This teaching was met with dramatic opposition. Many would not accept this teaching.
Every other time there was misunderstanding, Jesus would go out of his way to clear up confusion.

infoSeeds.infoText: He did not go back on his word, but repeated it multiple tiems.
He turned to his diciples and asked, "Will you leave me too?"
Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him on the last day. For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
infoSeeds.supportText: The word for eat is Trogo, meaning to gnaw in Greek.

infoSeeds.infoSupportText: The word for eat is Trogo, meaning to gnaw in Greek.
Jesus did not back down. He persisted!
infoSeeds.text: This teaching was met with dramatic opposition. Many would not accept this teaching.
Every other time there was misunderstanding, Jesus would go out of his way to clear up confusion.

infoSeeds.infoText: He did not go back on his word, but repeated it multiple tiems.
He turned to his diciples and asked, "Will you leave me too?"

infoSeeds.text: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him on the last day. For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
infoSeeds.infoSupportText: The word for eat is Trogo, meaning to gnaw in Greek.
Jesus did not back down. He persisted!
infoSeeds.text: This teaching was met with dramatic opposition. Many would not accept this teaching.
Every other time there was misunderstanding, Jesus would go out of his way to clear up confusion.

infoSeeds.infoText: He did not go back on his word, but repeated it multiple tiems.
He turned to his diciples and asked, "Will you leave me too?"
Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him on the last day. For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
infoSeeds.supportText: The word for eat is Trogo, meaning to gnaw in Greek.
